result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyrone J E Bearder

defendant.name: Bearder, Tyrone J E
defendant.address: 412 S. Main Street, Fall River, WI 53932

records.addlTxt:
8:30 AM -22CF119-Defendant Tyrone J E Bearder in court. Attorney Alyssa F. George in court for Tyrone J E Bearder.  Attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for State of Wisconsin. Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 5 days mtns; tsc set; bail con't. Atty George notes they wish to proceed to plea/sentencing at this time. 8:35 am recess to allow time for parties to discuss plea; Reconvene 8:51 AM Court calls cases 22CF119/22CF149. Appearance remain the same. Cases will proceed to plea and sentencing at this time; Victim rights compliance has been met; Court reviews plea agreement, charges, and penalties.
As to case 22CF119 count 3 (repeater), def enters a plea of no contest. Case 22CF119 count 4 (repeater), def enters a plea of no contest. Def makes statement. Court allows time for Atty George and def to have discussion. Recess 9:06 AM Reconvene 9:11 AM. Atty George gives update. Court questions defendant. Def states he would like to move forward with plea/sentencing at this time.
Court makes findings, accepts pleas, and finds the def guilty. Counts 1,2,5, and 6 are DRI. Case 22CF149 is DRI. State of WI will not pursue charges in incidents which occurred on 2-28-22 and 3-15-22. Sentencing arguments heard; def does not make statement. Court addresses defendant.
Court imposes the following sentence:
Sentence withheld
Probation for a period of 24 months with the following conditions (as to each of the counts):
Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription
Anger management  and domestic abuse assessment and any treatment
Absolute sobriety
No presence at bars, taverns, liquor stores
No contact with victim unless in therapeutic setting and with approval of Agent
No violent or abusive behavior with anyone
Court costs
DNA + costs
Victim makes statement
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim and their residence.

12:52 PM Prosecuting attorney Gilbert Grant Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tyrone J E Bearder appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Marie Findley (eligible) appeared by video for Tyrone J E Bearder. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions: Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim and their residence.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
